Job Posting: 177346 - Position: S26 Data Engineering Intern 177346 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 01/26/2026 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 01/19/2026 02:48 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country Electronic Arts (EA Canada) Inc. Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2026 - Summer S26 Data Engineering Intern 177346 Co-op Position Vancouver, BC Canada 4 months Hybrid CAD 0.0 per hour for 0 Major List $65,000 - $70,000 Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen. Electronic Arts is looking for students to join our world-class internship experience. For more information about our Emerging Talent Program, visit https://www.ea.com/careers/interns-and-university-graduates Join our Enterprise Insights team to support major game titles. As a Data Engineering Intern, you will help us develop data products and improve ETL pipelines alongside analysts, data engineers/architects and product managers. You will work in Hybrid remote/in-office role, with 3 days in office weekly at one of our Locations in Canada (#LI-Hybrid). Responsibilities: • You will collaborate with us on data requirements and ETL documentation. • You will assist us in the development of data pipelines and data products. • You will help us support data quality, contribute to data modelling, and data architecture. You will learn to work with big data tools under senior guidance. • Job Requirements Qualifications: • SQL and database experience (coursework/projects). • Familiarity with cloud tools like Snowflake or Databricks. • Python and version control (e.g., GitHub) skills. • Interest in data modelling and warehousing. Exposure to AWS, Azure, or GCP. • You must be available for a full-time paid internship in the summer of 2026. At this time, we are considering Undergrad students who will be enrolled in an accredited degree program in the summer of 2026 (May), slated to graduate no earlier than December 2026. Applicants must be legally authorized to work in Canada on a full-time basis during the 16-week internship. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. Please ensure that your graduation date is visible on your resume. Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Application Link: Data Engineering Intern - 210927 - Electronic Arts Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
